bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 117 (Thursday, June 25, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LATTA:H.R. 7362.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3: Congress shall have thepower . . . ``to regulate Commerce with foreign Nations, andamong the several States, and with the Indian tribes.''[Page H2517]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
Winning the International Race for Economic Leadership and Expanding Service to Support Leadership Act or the WIRELESS Leadership Act

This bill limits the authority of, and imposes deadlines on, state and local governments regarding decisions about the placement, construction, and modification of personal wireless service facilities.

bill.title: WIRELESS Leadership Act

item.title: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to streamline siting processes for personal wireless service facilities, including small personal wireless service facilities, and for other purposes.
Winning the International Race for Economic Leadership and Expanding Service to Support Leadership Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
